mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="m[z,t(z)]=-2.5\,\rmn{log}\,\frac{\int\limits_{-\infty}^{\infty}d\lambda\,%
\lambda\frac{L_{\lambda}[\lambda(1+z)^{-1},t(z)]}{(1+z)4\pi\,d_{L}^{2}(z)}\,R(%
\lambda)}{\int\limits_{-\infty}^{\infty}d\lambda\,\lambda\,C_{\lambda}(\lambda%
)R(\lambda)}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>z</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>z</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mn>2.5</mn></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>λ</mi></mpadded></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>λ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>z</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>π</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>z</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></munderover><mrow><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>λ</mi></mpadded></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>λ</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>λ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>R</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $n_{k'}$ is the number of possible values for the physical parameter $x_{k'}$ ($k\ne\,k'$), for a fixed metallicity, prescription for attenuation by dust, and set of tracks; and $\chi_{x_1,\,x_2,\,x_3}^2$ is obtained from:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="p(x_{k}|\mathbf{y}_{\rmn{obs}};\mathbf{\sigma})\propto\sum_{k^{\prime}=1}^{n_{%
k^{\prime}}}\rmn{exp}(\frac{-\chi_{x_{1},\,x_{2},\,x_{3}}^{2}}{2})" display="block"><mrow><mi>p</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi>𝐲</mi><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><mi>σ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>∝</mo><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msup><mi>k</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><msub><mi>n</mi><msup><mi>k</mi><mo>′</mo></msup></msub></munderover><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>p</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>χ</mi><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: where the sum is over the number of filters. The expression for $A_{x_1,\,x_2,\,x_3}$ is found by minimizing the difference between observed and model magnitudes:
prevtext: where $n_{k'}$ is the number of possible values for the physical parameter $x_{k'}$ ($k\ne\,k'$), for a fixed metallicity, prescription for attenuation by dust, and set of tracks; and $\chi_{x_1,\,x_2,\,x_3}^2$ is obtained from:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\chi_{x_{1},x_{2},x_{3}}^{2}=\sum_{i=1}^{5}\frac{(y_{\rmn{obs,i}}-A_{x_{1},\,x%
_{2},\,x_{3}}\,\cdot\,y_{\rmn{mod,i}})^{2}}{\sigma_{\rmn}{i}^{2}}" display="block"><mrow><msubsup><mi>χ</mi><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></munderover><mfrac><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>s</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msub><mi>A</mi><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo rspace="4.2pt">⋅</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>i</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math>

prevtext: where the sum is over the number of filters. The expression for $A_{x_1,\,x_2,\,x_3}$ is found by minimizing the difference between observed and model magnitudes:

mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="A_{x_{1},\,x_{2},\,x_{3}}=\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{5}y_{\rmn{obs,i}}\,\cdot\,y_{\rmn{%
mod,i}}}{\sum_{i=1}^{5}y_{\rmn{mod,i}}^{2}}" display="block"><mrow><msub><mi>A</mi><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo rspace="4.2pt">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></msubsup><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msub><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>s</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo rspace="4.2pt">⋅</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></msubsup><msubsup><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><merror class="ltx_ERROR undefined undefined"><mtext>\rmn</mtext></merror><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>
